    • The quality of the reconstructed beams was analyzed, and a slight non-uniform depolarization was observed, likely due to local strains.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing squirrel cage rotors of dynamoelectric machines to obtain resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor.
    • The test apparatus comprises a test head that accepts and causes relative angular movement between the rotor and test head.
        • The test head includes exciting means for magnetizing the rotor during angular movement in response to an alternating current.
        • Voltage sensing means generates a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations generated by the rotor.
        • Current sensing means senses the magnitude of the alternating current used to magnetize the rotor and generates a current signal.
        • Processing means determines the resistance and reactance of the rotor responsive to the voltage and current signals.
    • Skew sensing means senses the effective electrical skew of the rotor and generates an effective skew signal.
        • The processing means determines the effective electrical skew of the rotor responsive to the effective skew signal.
• The test apparatus provides automatic pass/fail determinations and detailed statistical comparison and evaluation of the measurement results.
</summary>

<summary>
* The text describes a method for securing a computing device by:
    * Granting a managed library access to native resources of an operating system in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library.
    * Denying a managed application access to native resources of the operating system, where the managed application includes a digital certificate authorizing the managed application to access a specific native resource of the operating system through the managed library.
* The text also describes a method for protecting a closed computing device from executing untrusted instructions by:
    * Receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library.
    * Authorizing the request to access the native system resource through the managed library, where the manager includes information that identifies managed libraries that the managed application is authorized to access, and the manager is effectuated by native instructions.
* The text further describes a method for publishing videogames configured to execute on a mobile device by:
    * Receiving a package from a networked computer system.
    * Identifying an executable in the package and verifying managed metadata associated with the executable, where the managed metadata describes the structure of the executable and includes type-safe code.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip.
    * Smart cards with IC chips are well known and can be contact or contactless.
    * Prior art cards have rigid cores with the electronic components secured by glue or mechanical means, which can lead to damage from bending.
    * The invention provides a low-cost, easily constructed identification card with shock-absorbing layers to protect the electronic components.
* The identification card comprises:
    * A core layer of silica-filled polyolefin with an antenna and computer chip.
    * A bottom sheet of silica-filled polyolefin attached to the core layer.
    * Rigid outer laminate layers encasing the core and bottom sheets.
* The card is manufactured by:
    * Pre-shrinking the core and bottom layers.
    * Printing indicia, antennae, and attaching the IC chip.
    * Laminating the layers with adhesive to encase the electronic components.
    * Applying additional laminate layers and personalization.
* The card design protects the electronic components by:
    * Using rigid outer layers to dissipate external forces.
    * Sandwiching the components between shock-absorbing layers.
    * Avoiding the use of rigid materials throughout the card.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory environment using a tree-shaped data structure.
    * The tree-shaped data structure has the following properties:
        * All leaf nodes are at the same level.
        * All internal nodes are full, except for the nodes on the left or right edge.
        * A maximum size is set for the nodes.
    * Additions are made to the first non-full node on the left edge, and deletions are made from the leaf node on the right edge.
    * A header node is introduced to improve the efficiency of the queue operations.
        * The header node has three elements: one pointing to the end, one to the middle tree, and one to the beginning.
        * The queue can be inverted in constant time and space by changing the value of an inversion bit in the header node.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to embedded EPROM devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies, such as DRAM and logic technologies.
    • The EPROM devices utilize DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, allowing them to be manufactured using the same processes as DRAM devices.
    • The invention also introduces "stress effect programmable read-only memory" (SEPROM) devices, which use the changes in transistor properties caused by electrical stresses to store data, allowing them to be manufactured using any IC technology.
• The key advantages of the EPROM and SEPROM devices include:
    • Ability to be manufactured using existing IC technologies, reducing cost and complexity.
    • Reduced programming and erase voltages compared to conventional EPROM devices.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a technique for determining the optimum value of feedback gain used for calculating correction amount in feedback control.
    * The method involves:
        * Provisionally determining a feedback gain value
        * Executing feedback control using the provisionally determined gain
        * Detecting the error between the designated and actual values of the subject of control
        * Calculating an evaluation value based on the detected error
        * Repeating the above steps with different gain values
        * Calculating the feedback gain value that provides a suitable evaluation value
    * The evaluation functions used are:
        * For proportional gain: Ratio of error curve length to time axis length
        * For integral gain: Integral of error
        * For differential gain: Integral of absolute error
    * The method can be applied to an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) running control, with the optimum gains determined for different sections of the running course.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a zoom lens with the following features:
    * Increased relative aperture and high zoom ratio while maintaining small physical size and high optical performance
    * Comprises 5 lens units: a positive first unit, a negative second unit, a negative third unit, a positive fourth unit, and a positive-negative-positive fifth unit
    * Satisfies specific conditions for the lens parameters of the fourth and fifth units to correct aberrations
    * Preferred design for the fourth and fifth units to further improve aberration correction
    * Numerical examples provided with specific lens data
* The key conditions and their significance are:
    * Condition (1): Limits the refracting power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth unit to control spherical aberration and coma
    * Condition (2): Limits the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth unit to correct spherical aberration
    * Condition (3): Limits the refractive power ratio of the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth unit to control astigmatism
    * Condition (4): Limits the Abbe numbers of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth unit to balance longitudinal and lateral chromatic aberrations
    * Condition (5): Limits the refractive power of the second unit to minimize variation of aberrations with zooming
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector.
    * The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through, converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying and/or recording the signal.
    * The device includes a detector, at least one amplification device for converting the charge pulse into an electric signal and amplifying it, and optionally a display and/or recording device.
* The invention aims to provide a method and device that can both measure individual particles and integrate a plurality of signals, without knowing the expected count or signal rates in advance.
    * The method involves discharging the charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side to improve the signal-to-noise ratio.
* The method and device can separate the signals based on their rate, with individual signals amplified in a fast amplifier and a plurality of signals integrated in a slow amplifier.
    * The separation is achieved using capacitors, inductors, or filters to block high- or low-frequency signals.
* The method and device can use overlapping signal rate ranges for the individual and integrated measurements to enable calibration.
    * The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material to detect uncharged particles.
* The method and device can use a material with fast charge transport, such as diamond, as the detector material to enable detection of individual particles at high count rates and precise integration of signals.
* The method and device can be used in various applications, such as particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices like X-ray and CT scanners.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly.
    • The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring.
    • The driven disc assembly is mounted on a splined hub connected to a torque motor.
• The movable ring is moved towards the stationary ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly.
    • The distance between the rings is measured by an electronic sensor.
    • The torque motor is then energized to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly.
• The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring to reduce the frictional force.
    • When the frictional force is reduced, the driven disc assembly will begin to rotate under the torque.
    • The difference between the initial and final distances between the rings is compared to a standard to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator.
    • It generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
    • The measurements can be stored for statistical process control.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to face age-estimation methods, systems, and software
    * The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images
    * The feature vectors are used as inputs to an age classifier and two aging functions
    * The age classifier distinguishes between youth (0-20 years) and adult (21-69 years) faces
    * The aging functions are constructed using support vector regression on the feature vectors
    * The appropriate aging function is applied based on the age group classification
    * The invention can provide a single estimated age or a set of estimated ages with confidence factors
    * The invention can be implemented using a computing system with a processor, memory, and storage device
    * The computing system can receive image data, extract features, and generate age estimations
    * The invention can be used in various applications, such as age-restricted access control and customer trend analysis
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, where:
    * The matrix display device comprises a mosaic of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels
    * A first number of pixels in each arrangement are dedicated to displaying the first image, and the remaining pixels are dedicated to displaying the second image
    * The two images can be redimensioned to match the definition of the matrix display device
    * The controller can apply attenuation functions to the pixels displaying the first image to enhance the visibility of the second image
    * The matrix display device can include separate controllers for the pixels displaying the first and second images
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, with a housing containing electronics and a communication means.
    * The transmitter has a removable payment element that can be used for cashless payment transactions, and a closure that protects the payment element when it is removed.
* The payment element can be brought into communication with an electronic payment system, and the transmitter can be set in a normal state or a secure state.
    * In the secure state, the payment element is removed, and the closure protects the contact elements in the housing.
* The closure can be movably mounted on the housing and can move between an active position and a passive position.
    * The closure can be designed as a dummy plug that is reliably held in the housing and seals the receptacle.
</summary>

<summary>
* The source document describes a method for charging toner used in an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, to maintain image quality during periods of inactivity.
    * The toner used in the imaging device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge, which can decrease during periods of inactivity, leading to inconsistent and darker image quality.
    * The method involves:
        * Determining periods of inactivity of the imaging device.
        * Charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.
    * The method can be implemented in software or hardware and can be used to overcome or reduce problems encountered in the related art developer.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can control the recording and reproduction of signals by plural heads with high precision.
    • The apparatus is provided with a control signal generator on the stationary drum side and a decoder circuit on the rotary drum side.
    • The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer and set the operating currents of the magneto resistive heads.
    • The control signals may include control information regarding a regenerative amplifier for reproduced outputs and recording current setting for recording heads.
• The invention also provides a recording/reproducing apparatus that can switch over among plural heads with high precision.
    • The apparatus is provided with a recording/reproducing unit, a generating unit for generating control data, and a transmitting unit for transmitting control data.
    • Data for controlling the switching over among the plurality of heads are transmitted with priority over other control data.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, particularly when a second object is adjacent to the first.
    • Prior art techniques include passive magnetic locators and active transmitter-receiver systems.
    • The invention provides a system and method that improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The invention employs a transmitter with a pair of antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the adjacent objects.
    • The receiver senses the magnetic fields associated with these currents and produces an output signal dependent on the sensing of both fields.
• The transmitter can be positioned optimally relative to the objects to enhance the performance of the system.
    • The currents in the objects can be distinguished by using different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different rates.
• The receiver processes the signals from the two fields to produce a pulsating output signal that is easier to distinguish from background noise.
    • The invention is particularly useful when the horizontal separation between the objects is less than 1.5 times the depth of the object to be located and traced.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
    • The apparatus includes a selector switch to connect the telephone network to the speaker phone in an automatic answering mode.
    • The apparatus includes a timer to limit the duration of the call and a bypass switch to extend the call duration.
    • The apparatus can be implemented using either electronic or electromechanical components.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplying energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals.
    • The system includes a trunk and branch fiber optic ring network with the following components:
        • An optical fiber cable trunk configured in a ring topology with one or more telecommunications hubs serially interconnected.
        • One or more branching units coupled serially along the optical fiber cable trunk, which allow for convenient add/drop points for telecommunications traffic from the cable trunk.
        • Branch fiber optic cables connected to the branching units, which are optically coupled at the other end to a cable station.
        • The branch fiber optic cables are used to unidirectionally transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength to power the optical amplifiers.
• The system has several advantages:
    • A single optical fiber cable trunk cut maintains full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations.
    • Branch fiber optic cable cuts simply isolate the associated cable station without compromising ring integrity.
    • The trunk and branch structure respects the sovereignty concerns that often arise in undersea communications networks.
    • The system is not restricted to fixed wavelength routing schemes and can accommodate reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that has no visible fasteners when installed.
    * The device consists of two parts:
        * An attachment member that is installed over the wiring device and mounted to it using available fasteners.
        * A cover plate member that is installed over the attachment member without visible fasteners.
    * The cover plate member can be easily installed and removed, and can accommodate variations in the flatness or evenness of the wall.
        * The attachment member has latching pawls that engage saw-tooth shaped racks on the cover plate member, allowing the cover plate to conform to the wall contour.
        * A tab on the attachment member can be used as a fulcrum to pry off the cover plate member when needed.
    * The device can be used to cover single or multiple wiring devices installed in ganged boxes.
        * The number of pawls, racks, and tabs varies depending on the number of wiring devices to be covered.
        * The arrangement ensures that the cover plate can be properly positioned over the wiring devices, even if the wall is not flat or even.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, such as a television or monitor.
    * The device consists of a number of annular strips that are concentrically nested and can slide over one another.
    * The strips can be folded in to cover one another, or extended to surround the screen and shield it from light.
    * The strips have a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, allowing the device to be positioned at various angles relative to the screen.
    * The strips have hooks and locking elements to ensure reliable folding in and out.
    * An adapter member can be used to attach the device to screens with flat or curved fronts.
    * The device is inexpensive to produce, easy to install, and operates reliably.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention discloses a solution that automatically informs a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that a listener can understand.
    * The invention can determine a speaking rate for the speaker and compare it against a speaking rate threshold based on the listener's proficiency with the language being spoken.
    * The speaker can be informed to slow down through a sensory mechanism of a wearable computing device, such as vibration, beeping, blinking, or displaying a message.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera
    • The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane
    • The device includes a cyclic line counter and a sawtooth generator synchronized with the counter to control the vertical deviation of the beam
• The device allows for higher picture sequence frequency compared to conventional TV cameras
    • The number of lines scanned per picture can be adjusted by programming the counter
    • The device can be used to record IR, UV, or X-ray pictures
• The video signals can be digitized and stored for analysis
    • The jumped-over lines can be completed by repetition or interpolation for optical representation
    • The scanning scheme can be moved from one cycle to the next to fill the interspaces between lines
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a solution for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a "blended call" in a packet-switched network.
    • A multimedia server with "blender" software is associated with a telephony server.
    • The blender software manages the blended calls, using the functions of the multimedia server and the telephony server as appropriate.
    • The blender software receives the call request and initiates a single session with two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.
    • The voice call component is handled through the telephony server, and the multimedia call component is handled through the multimedia server.
    • The blender may include an indication to prevent the telephony server from redirecting or looping the voice call component back to the blender.
    • The present invention is well-suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration.
    • An Intelligent Network (IN) signal may be used to determine if a blended call is being handled, and the call is referred to the blender if it is a blended call.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices
    * Allows any connected device to perform contextual synchronization over various communication networks
    * Employs a central reference point server and client devices to synchronize content
    * Supports synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices
    * Enables a client device to have the latest and most relevant content based on the user's and/or device's context
    * Provides flexibility to support content synchronization based on device context using dynamic attributes
    * Employs file compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to optimize the synchronization algorithm
    * Distributes the work of creating a delta list to the client device, making the system highly scalable
    * Supports resumption of synchronization from the specific bundle that experienced the failure during the last connection disruption
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system and method for allowing a finder of a lost or misplaced object to anonymously communicate with the owner of the object.
    * Owners are provided with tags that have a unique ID and a reference to a specific website or virtual locale.
    * Owners can register the tag IDs and their contact information on a centralized and network-accessible database.
    * Finders can access the website or virtual locale and communicate with the owner using the unique ID, without revealing their own identity.
* The system allows for anonymous communication between the finder and the owner to facilitate the return of the lost object.
    * Finders can view open cases, close cases, and send messages to owners without revealing their identity.
    * Owners can view open cases, close cases, and communicate with finders while maintaining their privacy.
    * The system uses anonymized email addresses and messaging protocols to enable the anonymous communication.
* The system is designed to be user-friendly and accessible to both owners and finders.
    * New users can easily sign up and register their information.
    * Existing users can edit their account settings and manage their registered tags.
    * The system provides clear and intuitive menus and interfaces for both owners and finders.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to electron multipliers used in photomultipliers and particle detectors
    * The invention uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons
    * The foils are arranged in a sequential series and a voltage is applied to each foil
    * The voltage accelerates electrons emitted from the back of one foil to transmit through the next foil
    * This generates secondary electrons that add to the transmitted electrons and continue to the next foil
    * The foil electron multiplier has a higher gain per stage compared to other electron multipliers
    * The foil electron multiplier is simpler and cheaper to fabricate than other electron multipliers
    * The foil electron multiplier can cover a larger area and is more robust than other electron multipliers
    * The foil electron multiplier exhibits an intrinsic rejection of ion feedback
</summary>

<summary>
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention allows ordinary 2-dimensional motion pictures to be viewed in part as a 3-dimensional experience.
    * It takes advantage of the Pulfrich effect, where lateral motion of a motion picture will appear 3-dimensional to the viewer.
    * The viewing glasses have individually controllable lenses, a digital sensor to capture the motion picture, and a processor to process the images and control the lens states.
* The lenses can take three different states:
    * Clear-clear for both lenses when no lateral motion is detected.
    * Clear-darkened for left-to-right lateral motion.
    * Darkened-clear for right-to-left lateral motion.
* The Glass Lens Controller Unit (GLCU) records images of the motion picture, processes them to identify synchronization events, and controls the lens states accordingly.
    * The GLCU uses an intensity edge finding algorithm to detect lateral motion and its direction.
    * The decision procedure controls the lens states based on the identified synchronization events.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes the problems of previous 3-dimensional motion picture technologies.
    * No special equipment is needed for filming, projection, or viewing.
    * It works with any motion picture format, old or new.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope can be extended to other visual effects beyond the Pulfrich illusion.
    * It can use more complex algorithms to detect different types of motion.
    * It can control the lenses in more sophisticated ways to enhance the 3-dimensional effect.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw.
    • The method involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying mechanical pressure to the wafer, causing a "clean break" along the scribe lines and singulating the individual die.
    • The apparatus comprises a pad for supporting the wafer, a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply mechanical pressure to the wafer for singulation.
        • The wafer can be back-grinded to reduce its thickness before singulation.
        • The trenches can be formed by etching or partially cutting the wafer using a wafer saw.
        • The trenches can be formed on the active surface or the non-active surface of the wafer.
        • The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion to cause the wafer to break along the scribe lines.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display (FED) device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements
    * The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that is negatively charged to deflect positive ions away from the cathode and field emission elements
    * The reduction plates can be arranged in different configurations, such as elongated and parallel to the cathode strips or in a meshwork/net-shaped pattern
* The reduction plates are fabricated on the same plane as the cathode strips, with an insulating layer in between
    * This allows the reduction plates and cathode strips to be manufactured together using photolithography techniques
* The negatively charged reduction plates attract the positive ions formed by the high-energy electrons, preventing them from reaching the cathode and causing current surges
    * This prolongs the lifetime of the field emission elements in the FED device
* The protection structure can substantially improve the reliability and lifetime of FED devices
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes
    * The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and edges
    * One of the edges has a surface that is receptive to light, and an image sensor element is formed adjacent to this edge
* The image sensor includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region
    * Charge carriers are generated in the image sensing region by light impinging on the edge surface
* A means in the substrate guides the charge carriers in the image sensing region toward the charge collection and transfer means
    * The substrate includes a highly doped bottom layer and a more lightly doped upper layer
    * Three columns of image sensor elements are formed in the substrate, with one column adapted for the top imaging plane and two columns adapted for the edge imaging planes
* The image sensor can be used to image in multiple planes, including simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or surface imaging of passageways
    * The edge imaging is made possible by doped layers that create a waveguide-like structure adjacent the edges
    * The invention can be easily incorporated into various types of known image sensors using compatible processing techniques
* The image sensor has a first imaging plane on one edge, a second imaging plane on the top surface, and a third imaging plane on the other edge
    * Charge carriers generated by light on the edge imaging planes are guided toward the charge collection and transfer means by the doped layers
    * The increased doping in the layers creates a barrier to electron movement, effectively guiding the charge carriers toward the center of the substrate
* A second embodiment extends the CCD regions to the edges, improving charge collection and reducing crosstalk
    * The bond pads are shifted to the ends of the sensor to avoid interference with the imaging surfaces
    * Opaque coatings can be applied to the die edges to prevent stray light absorption
* The image sensor can be used in various applications, including simultaneous imaging of multiple planes and color imaging with filters
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems
    • The invention aims to minimize the total power consumption of a home network
    • The invention ensures that the best qualified network slave node is promoted to the network master role
    • The invention ensures that the home network is not lost when the network master node enters power save mode
• The invention provides methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device
    • The master device sends data to the slave device to enable it to perform the network administrative functions
    • The master device then enters a power management state
    • The slave device becomes the new network master node
• The invention allows the network master node to enter power save mode when not performing its nominal device functions
    • This minimizes the total power consumption of the home network
    • The network administrative functions are transferred to a network slave node
    • The selected network slave node becomes the new network master node
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
    • The prior art of UK 1449196 describes the use of a triplet to define fixed angles in the elevation plane, within which angle measurements were made by other means.
    • This invention extends these ideas to optimize angle measurements, using the triplet itself, notably over selected sectors at low elevation angles.
    • The array may either operate in a receive mode, in which case unambiguous angle measurement is provided by the signal processing circuits embodied in the antennae receivers, or in a transmit mode in which case the transmitted signal from each antenna in the array must be coded so that it can be identified to enable a quotient representing angle to be derived for each triplet in a remote receiver.
• The antenna array comprises at least four antennae spaced so as to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
    • Each triplet will be characterized by the spacing of its elements and the height of the centre element above the ground plane.
    • Radio receiver means are used to obtain from each antenna of each triplet an information signal of which both amplitude and phase relative to the amplitude and phase of information signals obtained from other antennae of each triplet are functions of the elevation angles θ of incidence upon the array of a radio wave arriving from a remote source and of the ground reflection coefficient p.
• The array can be used to monitor the height of aircraft approaching to land, which has not been easily achieved with the standard secondary surveillance radar system.
    • The array can provide coding, by radio transmissions, of angles in space.
    • The array can be used for civil and military applications, where the measurement of the elevation angle of an emitting or reflecting object is required.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to high-intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high-intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid-tight seal.
    • The use of adhesives to support the glass envelope within a metal sleeve has several problems:
        • Adhesives break down due to thermal cycling.
        • Differences in thermal expansion coefficients between glass and metal cause destructive shear.
        • Liquid cleaning procedures can degrade the adhesive.
        • Moisture can migrate through the adhesive, causing corrosion and early lamp failures.
    • The invention uses a high-temperature polymer, such as a fluoroelastomer, to directly surround and be in compression contact with the glass envelope.
    • The polymeric material provides extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
    • The polymeric seal support forms a housing around both the glass envelope and the abbreviated height one-piece conductive base, creating a liquid-tight seal.
    • The invention eliminates the need for adhesives or cements, allowing for closer tolerance centering of the lamp glass envelope.
    • The invention minimizes the number of sealing points and maximizes the length of the seal surface to prevent the ingress of deleterious fluids.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a technique for realizing a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) Precoder for multi-user (MU) MIMO systems, which significantly reduces the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss.
    • The technique relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (Szz) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise," which is the key component in conventional design of a GDFE Precoder and requires extensive computational cost.
    • The technique provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder and does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (Sxx) for downlink channel is rank deficient.
• The technique computes a filter matrix C using one of several alternative formulas, and based on the computation of the filter matrix C, computes the transmit filter matrix B, the feedforward filter matrix F, and the interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
    • The technique avoids the use of Szz for computing the matrix C and subsequently other dependent matrices of the GDFE Precoder.
    • The technique can be used for any arbitrary channel matrix H, and when the rank of the channel matrix is greater than or equal to its number of rows, a simplified expression can be used for computing the matrix C.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, particularly an axial fan with increased intake airflow rate without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements.
    • The housing includes an outer frame with a passage for guiding air streams, where the sidewall of the passage extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake or discharge area.
        • The sidewall can extend radially outwards in a symmetrical, frustum-conical, or frustum-elliptically conical manner.
        • The sidewall can be formed with an inclined portion or a beveled edge.
        • The radially outward extension of the sidewall can be partially cut off to form a notch to enlarge the intake area for lateral side air streams.
    • The dimension of the impeller's blade increases along with the radially outward extension of the sidewall to increase the airflow rate and heat-dissipating efficiency.
    • The passage formed by the sidewall of the housing has a gradually reduced cross-sectional area from the inlet to the outlet, which can effectively concentrate the air streams to the center portion of the heat sink with the highest temperature.
    • The heat-dissipating device can be used with a heat sink and mounted within a system casing with electrical elements to dissipate the heat generated during operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The electroluminescent display panel can display different colors by changing the driving voltage
    * The panel has a first luminescent layer that emits light without visible red components and a second luminescent layer that emits light with visible red components
    * The threshold voltages for the single layer portion and the double layer portion are different, allowing the panel to display green light at low voltage and lemon light at high voltage
    * The color purity can be adjusted by changing the width or thickness of the second luminescent layer
    * The panel can also use a color filter to display different colors, such as yellow or blue-green, at high voltage
* The manufacturing process involves forming the various layers on a glass substrate
    * The insulation layers, luminescent layers, and electrodes are deposited and patterned using sputtering, vapor deposition, and etching techniques
    * The materials used for the luminescent layers can be varied, such as using SrS:Ce for the first layer to emit blue-green light
    * The color filter can be made of a resin with black pigment or a resist filter with red dye or pigment
    * The electrodes can be patterned to create a display with a specific design, rather than a matrix
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony
    • The terminal comprises audio means, converting means, and protocol means
    • The terminal further comprises wireless communications means for wireless near field communication with a connecting unit
    • The terminal can independently control and communicate data packets according to a standardized Internet/network protocol
• The invention also relates to a system for Internet telephony and a method for the same
    • The system comprises a portable communications terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server
    • The method involves reproducing and recording sound, converting the signals, and handling communication according to a standardized Internet/network protocol, with wireless near field communication with a connecting unit
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, which involves:
    • Growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate
    • Depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer
• The invention also describes a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, comprising:
    • A buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate
    • A Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer
</summary>

<summary>
* Receiver input circuits with preamplifier, mixer, and amplification control
    * Aim to achieve a favorable compromise between small and large signal behavior, and low production cost
    * Amplification control using PIN diodes to protect semiconductor components from distortions
* Limitations of existing circuits
    * Noise level increases with control attenuation, requiring high signal levels for sufficient S/N ratio
    * Amplification control using preamplifier transistor causes non-linearity and signal distortions
* Invention: Receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops
    * First control loop to avoid overloading of mixer stage and varactor diodes
    * Second control loop to avoid overloading of mixer stage and frequency influences on oscillator
    * Third control loop with lower response threshold and bandwidth to support the other control loops
* Embodiment of the input circuit
    * PIN diode in the input network for controllable signal attenuation
    * Rectifier circuits arranged to avoid signal distortions
    * Capacitor for quick charging and slow discharging to eliminate interference from amplitude-modulated spurious signals
* Extended input network with additional PIN diode and reactances
    * Provides greater control range and selectivity
    * Maintains desired source impedance for the preamplifier transistor during control
* Tunable network with iteration-free alignment
    * Separate supply and adjustment of tuning voltage for varactor diodes
    * Allows for L and C alignment of the tuning circuits
* Tunable network with a single twin varactor diode
    * Provides high degree of identity in the C(U) characteristic of the varactor diodes
    * Eliminates the need for separate adjustment of the tuning voltage
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for spontaneously setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals during a telephone call.
    * The system uses a collaboration button and indicator on a telephone set to enable collaboration between the parties.
    * The system automatically detects if the parties have compatible collaboration applications and enables the collaboration indicator accordingly.
    * The collaboration can be initiated by pressing the collaboration button, which launches the collaboration applications on the parties' desktop computers.
* The system can be implemented using a call control unit or in a peer-to-peer architecture, and can support multiparty collaboration.
    * The telephone and computer can be physically separate or integrated, and the voice capability can be provided through the computer.
    * The invention can be implemented as a computer program and can be carried on various forms of media, including signals.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for inserting advertising clips into a video sequence while optimizing the visual impact of the advertising clip.
    * The method involves:
        * Generating a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point.
        * Generating a salience map for each advertising clip in a set of advertising clips.
    * The method determines a degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of each advertising clip.
        * The degree of similarity is based on the comparison of the location of the salience zones in the maps.
* The advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity is selected and inserted into the video sequence at the insertion point.
    * The insertion point can be a shot change in the video sequence.
* The salience maps are generated using the last n pictures of the video sequence before the insertion point and the first p pictures of the advertising clip.
    * Different methods are proposed to determine the degree of similarity between the salience maps.
* The invention also relates to a device for implementing the method.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to the use of a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections in very small dimension semiconductor devices, such as high-speed and high-density integrated circuits.
    • The recessed mask structure is positioned below the surface to be planarized, where there will be a lower electric field, typically in the range of 0.5 to 20 nanometers, with 5 nanometers being preferred.
    • The recessed mask structure provides several benefits, including:
        • The high electric field is away from the cap-mask interface, minimizing damage to the conductive liner and metal contamination.
        • The thickness of the high-k mask material can be minimized, leading to a lower overall capacitance and faster signal propagation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a Downconverting Digitizer that can sample and downconvert a modulated IF signal to digital in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) baseband components.
    * The Downconverting Digitizer consists of several key elements:
        * A digitally-controlled variable gain amplifier that adjusts the amplitude of the modulated IF input signal
        * A predictive digital filter that generates a prediction of the modulated IF signal
        * An offset nuller element that dynamically removes offsets introduced by the implementation
        * An automatic gain control (AGC) loop that maintains the amplitude of the modulated carrier within the dynamic range of the predictive loop
        * A digital quadrature mixer that downconverts the output of the predictive filter to baseband I and Q components
        * Rate reduction filters that filter and reduce the sampling rate of the I and Q outputs
* The placement of the sampler inside the predictive loop allows the predictive filter to be implemented using digital signal processing techniques, reducing the complexity of the overall converter.
* Operating the predictive encoder in a subharmonic mode allows further reduction in the complexity of the digital logic used in implementing the predicting digital filter.
* Using the digital predictive loop output to control the gain level applied to the input signal allows further increase of the dynamic range of the converter.
* Incorporating a built-in offset nuller dramatically enhances the DC offset performance of the analog-to-digital conversion process.
* The Downconverting Digitizer was implemented in a CMOS integrated circuit and achieved more than 52 dB of dynamic range without the AGC loop, and more than 124 dB with the AGC loop.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to active solid state devices, specifically to apparatus and method for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms or gas molecules.
    * Nanowires and nanotubes have the potential for very high-sensitivity detection since the depletion or accumulation of charge carriers, which is caused by binding of a charged biological macromolecules at the surface, can affect the entire cross-sectional conduction pathway of these nanostructures.
    * Nanoimprint Lithography (NIL) solves the problem of limited minimum feature sizes and high cost by patterning nano-scale features into a quartz plate, referred to as the "template" that can be applied directly to the surface of a wafer and transferring the pattern 1:1 into a photoresist layer.
    * The problem of reproducibly fabricating semiconducting active layers that provide the necessary nano-dimensional features for direct electrical detection in sensing applications is solved using nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
    • The method involves plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
    • The method can use either full cutting or partial cutting techniques to singulate the semiconductor packages, with the partial cutting technique allowing for the formation of steps or beveled edges on the side surfaces.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN)
    * The WLAN gathers information about neighboring WWAN base stations and provides this information to the mobile terminal
* The mobile terminal has a first network module (e.g., GSM) for connecting to the WWAN and a second network module (e.g., WiFi) for connecting to the WLAN
    * When the mobile terminal connects to the WLAN, the first network module is turned off and the second network module is turned on
* When the signal level from the WLAN drops below a threshold, the first network module is turned on and uses the information from the WLAN to quickly connect to the WWAN
    * This helps avoid dropped or delayed connections, especially for voice communication
* The invention provides a method for the mobile terminal to select a serving base station of the WWAN using the information from the WLAN
    * The second network module receives the service information from the WLAN and passes it to the first network module
    * The first network module then selects a serving base station from the WWAN based on the service information
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a new process for manufacturing multilayered electrical components, such as capacitors, coils, and resistors.
    * The process involves the following steps:
        * Providing a first electrode and a first electrical component, and locating the electrode in a recess formed by the component to produce a first laminate sub-assembly.
        * Providing a second electrode and a second electrical component, and locating the electrode in a recess formed by the second component to produce a second laminate sub-assembly.
        * Locating the two sub-assemblies in mutually stacked relation to form a resultant assembly.
* The process offers several advantages over conventional methods:
    * Elimination of costly steps, such as cutting and end-termination.
    * Ability to produce smaller and more complex component shapes.
    * Enhanced in-process inspection and quality control.
    * Reduced risk of defects, such as delamination and microcracks.
* The process can be adapted to manufacture a variety of electronic ceramic devices, including:
    * Multilayer ceramic capacitors.
    * Multilayer ferrite inductors.
    * Multilayer substrates with buried metal circuitry.
    * Semiconductor packages.
    * Precision resistors and resistor-coil combinations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a hierarchical lattice structure with multiple cell sizes for improved specific stiffness and strength.
    • The lattice structure comprises a primary array of first order cells and an ancillary array of second order cells.
        • The ancillary array is nested with the primary array, with the second order cells co-aligned with the first order cells.
        • The lattice structure can be mated with an oppositely oriented lattice structure to form a balanced or mated lattice structure.
        • Face sheets can be attached to the mated lattice structure to form a sandwich panel.
    • The unit cells can be fabricated using injection molding and further processed for deposition of other materials.
        • The unit cells can be made from various materials, including polymers, metals, ceramics, and composites.
        • The lattice structure can be used in various applications, such as structural materials, impact/blast mitigation, heat exchange, and energy storage.
    • The invention is related to and incorporates by reference several prior patent applications and scientific articles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The process co-produces power and hydrocarbons by integrating an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility and a Coal-to-Liquid (CTL) facility.
    • The IGCC facility includes a wet gasification stage that produces a combustion gas at high pressure, which is then used to generate power.
    • The CTL facility includes a dry gasification stage that produces a synthesis gas precursor, which is then used for hydrocarbon synthesis.
    • The process benefits from economies of scale, efficient utilization of utilities, and the ability to capture and sequester CO2.
• The integration of the IGCC and CTL facilities allows for optimal energy efficiency and carbon management.
    • The IGCC facility can be sized to maximize power export, while the CTL facility can benefit from the IGCC facility's power generation.
    • The shared air separation unit and utility systems result in cost savings and improved overall efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, with an improvement in the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface.
    * A blocking film (passivation film) is uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen from that surface.
    * Oxygen is added onto the surface or portion close to the surface, and the entire body is heat-treated to position the added oxygen in the appropriate atom location, and to convert the film into a highly dense insulating material to provide a more complete blocking layer.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an apparatus for the preparation of foam sheet samples for microscopic examination.
    • The apparatus allows for the precise cutting of foam sheet samples to a uniform thickness with parallel cut edges, preserving the cell structure of the foam for detailed microscopic examination.
• The apparatus features a clamping mechanism to hold the foam sheet in place, a screw-thread mechanism to advance the foam sheet in precise increments, and a razor blade to cut the foam sheet samples.
    • The precise cutting of the foam samples allows for examination of differences in physical properties, such as brittleness and insulative qualities, between foam materials that may appear similar in other tests.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination and leveling seismic motion detectors in seismometers designed to operate on the ocean floor.
    * Seismometers, especially "ocean bottom seismometers" (OBS), pose challenges in positioning and coupling the seismic motion detectors to the ocean floor.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive method to determine the angle of inclination assumed by the seismometer during operation.
    * The angle of inclination can be determined by measuring the acute angle formed by the pendulum-mounted detector and a known vertical reference when the detector is locked in position.
* The invention also provides a simple and inexpensive apparatus for preserving the orientation assumed by the seismometer during operation.
    * The apparatus uses a spring-loaded plunger to lock the pendulum-mounted detector in its assumed position.
* The invention provides a mounting and clamping mechanism that improves the acoustic coupling between the ocean bottom and the seismic motion detector.
    * The detector is rigidly connected to the seismometer frame, which is embedded in the ocean floor, providing a good path for seismic waves.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive apparatus for self-leveling the seismic motion detectors used in an OBS.
    * The pendulum-mounted detector is automatically aligned with the vertical when the seismometer is deployed.
* The invention combines the features of determining the angle of inclination and self-leveling the seismic motion detectors.
    * The pendulum-mounted detector is locked in its assumed position, allowing the angle of inclination to be measured.
</summary>

<summary>
• The humidity sensing element of the present invention comprises:
    • A first electron conductive electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material deposited in the interstices of the dielectric, a second electron conductive electrode pervious to moisture vapor, and an ion-forming material in the dielectric.
    • The humidity element is manufactured by:
        • Coating a first electrode with a porous dielectric coating, depositing conductive particles in the dielectric, contacting the particles with an ion-forming material, and forming a second electrode on the dielectric.
        • The preferred method includes using aluminum for the first electrode, anodizing it to form the dielectric, vacuum depositing nickel particles in the dielectric, and vacuum depositing nickel for the second electrode.
    • The humidity element has several advantages, including:
        • Rapid response time, physical sturdiness, and linearity of impedance with relative humidity.
        • The impedance varies inversely with relative humidity due to the combination of capacitance and temperature-dependent resistance.
        • Excitation with a 10 Hz AC voltage optimizes the linearity of the humidity response.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly with a force transmission structure
    * The motor assembly comprises a motor, a gear train, and a force transmission structure
    * The force transmission structure includes a drive plate and a shaft
    * The drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three interconnected sections
    * The shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth that fit into the sections of the mounting hole
* The drive plate and shaft are designed to reduce vibration and noise
    * The Y-shaped mounting hole and toothed portion provide a stable connection
    * The greater contact area between the drive plate and shaft can withstand higher torque
    * The drive plate is made of a plastics material that can absorb vibration
    * The buffer holes in the drive plate aid in the molding process
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver
    • The system comprises an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem
        • The radio frequency subsystem includes a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator
        • The baseband subsystem includes a free running counter coupled to the high and low frequency oscillators
        • The free running counter provides a mobile time reference to the system and has a wake mode and a sleep mode
        • During the wake mode, the free running counter uses the high frequency oscillator to generate the mobile time reference
        • During the sleep mode, the free running counter uses the low frequency oscillator to maintain the mobile time reference
• The invention also provides a method of generating a mobile time reference
    • The method includes providing a high frequency clock, providing a low frequency clock, generating a mobile time reference using the high frequency clock, maintaining the mobile time reference using the low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available, and continuing to generate the mobile time reference using the high frequency clock when the high frequency clock is again available
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a protective helmet with a custom-fitted liner assembly
    * The liner assembly is made of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with an array of pockets
    * The pockets are open and unfilled, allowing the layers to deform and conform to the wearer's head
    * This design simplifies the manufacturing process and eliminates the need for drawstrings or tensioning
    * The liner can be refitted to accommodate changes in head size by heating and reshaping the layers
* The helmet consists of an outer shell and an inner thermoplastic liner
    * The liner is made of four layers of vacuum-formed thermoplastic sheets
    * The layers are arranged with the protuberances of adjacent layers not necessarily in register
    * A comfort foam layer and a fabric lining are added to the inner surface of the liner
    * The liner is secured to the outer shell using hook-and-loop fasteners
* The custom-fitting process involves heating the liner, placing it on the wearer's head, and allowing it to cool and solidify
    * This process can be repeated to refit the liner to a different individual or to accommodate changes in the same individual's head size
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a multiorifice structure and a method of fabrication, particularly for use in an automotive fuel injector valve.
    • The multiorifice structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members.
        • Each successive layer of rods is disposed at a progressively larger angle with respect to the axis of the fused assembly.
        • The fused assembly is then cut into thin wafers, and the interstices between the rods and cylindrical members form angularly disposed passageways.
        • The thickness of the wafer is determined by the effective aperture of the interstices and is sufficient to impart a directional component to the fluid passing through.
        • The triangular-shaped orifices are more effective in atomizing the exiting fluid compared to circular orifices.
• The method of fabrication involves twisting rods around a core rod and sheathing them in cylindrical members, then fusing the assembly.
    • The rods and cylindrical members may be coated with a lower melting temperature material to facilitate fusion.
    • The fused assembly is then sliced to produce the multiorifice structures.
    • The sliced surfaces may be ground or polished to achieve the desired surface finish or thickness uniformity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device with a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure.
    * The method involves forming an insulating layer on a gate electrode, forming a low density source/drain region using the gate electrode as a mask, forming a conductive layer on the insulating layer and anisotropically etching it to leave a portion on the gate sidewall, and then forming a high density source/drain region using the gate electrode and the conductive layer portion as a mask.
* The method also involves forming an oxide film on the gate sidewall using an insulating film on the gate as a mask, and then forming the high density source/drain region using the oxide film and the insulating film as a mask.
* The method further involves forming the gate sidewall portion using a high melting point metal or a silicide of such a metal, which can help derive hot carriers through the gate electrode and prevent transconductance degradation.
* The method also involves siliciding the gate electrode and/or the source/drain region to reduce their sheet resistance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides an enhanced radio telephone that can be used as an IP telephone in conjunction with a PC
    * The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder and decoder, allowing it to be used with a low-performance PC
    * The enhanced radio telephone can be connected to the PC via a cable or wireless connection, and the PC handles the conversion between coded speech and network protocol
    * The enhanced radio telephone can be switched between wireless and IP telephone modes either manually or automatically
* The invention provides several advantages over conventional IP telephone systems
    * The enhanced radio telephone is more convenient, economical, and efficient than a high-performance PC-based IP telephone
    * The enhanced radio telephone provides a comfortable handset and reduces echo problems associated with conventional IP telephones
    * The PC used with the enhanced radio telephone can be a low-end, low-cost device, as the speech coding and decoding is handled by the enhanced radio telephone
* The invention can be implemented in different ways
    * The enhanced radio telephone can have a separate connection for IP data transfer
    * The enhanced radio telephone can handle the conversion between coded speech and network protocol internally, without the need for a PC
    * The choice of implementation depends on the cost and performance requirements of the application
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to devices for producing electrical power, pressurized water, or other useful work from surface waves on a water body.
    * The devices use one or more submerged, gas-filled containers that expand and contract in response to overhead wave-induced pressure differences, producing useful work.
* The invention offers several advantages over prior art, including:
    * Reduced total and moving mass, leading to increased responsiveness and energy capture efficiency.
    * Use of atmospheric venting or partial evacuation to enhance container expansion and contraction.
    * Incorporation of overhead floating bodies to supplement energy capture.
* The invention can be configured in various ways, such as:
    * Vertically oriented, partially evacuated or surface-vented reinforced flexible bellows containers.
    * Expanded, partially evacuated or surface-vented reinforced flexible bellows containers with inclined and extended moving surfaces.
* The invention can also incorporate features like:
    * Wave focusing and reflection techniques to increase energy capture.
    * Adjustable depth mooring systems to optimize energy capture and survivability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to the mounting of blades for a scraped surface heat exchanger onto the central drive shaft.
    • Scraped surface heat exchangers are used in industry, such as in the processing of foodstuffs.
    • The blades are hingedly connected to the central drive shaft to help mix the material and/or scrape the inside surface of the outer tube.
    • The blades are typically installed on the drive shaft when it is removed from the outer tube, and it is desirable to keep the blades at a shallow angle during installation.
    • In a vertically arranged scraped surface heat exchanger, the blades may fall freely downward if they are not restrained during installation.
• The invention provides a method and apparatus to facilitate the mounting of a scraped surface heat exchanger blade onto a drive shaft, while still using a pin type connection.
    • The blade has a first side and a second side, a scraper edge and a hinge edge, and at least one mounting hole near the hinge edge.
    • The blade has a first L-shaped locking track on the first side and a second L-shaped locking track on the second side, each with an entry track and an intermediate track.
    • The pins on the drive shaft have an inner finger and an outer finger, which engage with the entry tracks and intermediate tracks on the blade.
    • The blade can be installed at an angle, slid onto the pins, and then rotated to a shallow angle for insertion into the outer tube, while being restrained from falling off the pins.
• The invention provides several advantages, including:
    • The blades can be positioned at the installation angle, slid onto the pins, and then slid downwardly along the pins without falling off.
    • The different widths of the entry tracks on the two sides of the blade ensure the blade is installed with the correct orientation.
    • The tracks on both sides of the blade help preserve the structural rigidity of the blade and accommodate wear over time.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process and an apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine.
    * The problem is to improve the avoidance of disruptions in the cigarette magazine.
    * The detection process uses an optical checking element, such as a camera, to scan an image of the cigarettes in the magazine, which is then evaluated by an image-processing device.
    * The detection apparatus includes an optical checking element, an image-processing device, and means to produce an error signal if the scanned image deviates from a reference image or value.
    * The elimination process detects a defective or incorrectly positioned cigarette and actuates an ejecting unit to eject a plurality of cigarettes from the ejecting zone.
    * The elimination apparatus has one or more adjacent ejecting units arranged in the region of the magazine to eject a plurality of cigarettes from the assigned ejecting zone.
    * The front and rear walls of the ejecting unit are of different sizes to avoid jamming of partially gripped cigarettes.
    * The cigarette magazine has a storage part, shaft groups, and oscillating rods to ensure uniform downward movement of the cigarettes.
    * The detection and elimination processes and apparatuses can be used to detect and eliminate various types of defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for interconnecting a high voltage cable with an apparatus and/or with a second high voltage cable, consisting of a cable termination and a rigid insulator.
    * The interface between the cable end and any accessory, between two cable ends, or between two apparatus is generally applicable, resulting in several advantages such as factory pretesting, reduction of installation time and cost, reduction of tools, and simplified field testing.
    * The invention provides three different interface methods: inner cone concept, outer cone concept, and no cone or slight inner cone concept.
* The invention includes several applications of the cable termination and rigid insulator concept, such as:
    * SF6 terminals, transformer terminals, and outdoor terminals.
    * Straight-through joints and transition joints between dry and oil-filled cables.
    * Joints between two apparatus, such as a transformer and a switching station.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool used in machining, which comprises a tool, its frame, and a tool holder in the frame of a machine tool.
    * The fixing mechanism can be used in a wide range of technologies, including machining by chipping, robot applications, and sheet machining centers.
    * The fixing mechanism uses a curved connecting surface between the tool frame and the tool holder, which allows for a simple and secure fixing of the tool.
    * The curved connecting surface and the contact surfaces between the tool frame and the tool holder are designed to transmit the machining force effectively.
* The invention provides an improved fixing mechanism compared to the prior art, which often uses a conic fit that can be problematic.
    * The conic fit can lead to the connecting surfaces being clamped too much, requiring complex release mechanisms.
    * The invention's curved connecting surface and contact surfaces provide a simpler and more secure fixing mechanism.
    * The invention can be implemented in various embodiments, including using a curved surface on the tool frame or the tool holder.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to switching circuitry that can be used to drive display drivers with high efficiency and low EMI output.
    * The invention utilizes switching regulator circuits with multiple circuit paths carrying current in opposite directions to cancel out radiated noise.
    * The invention also uses additional terminal lines to sink any remaining EMI generated in the outermost paths.
</summary>

<summary>
* The source document describes a power system that includes a battery with multiple cells, where a controller is configured to cause the cells to acquire charge for a period of time such that the voltages of the cells are approximately equal at the end of the period.
    * The rate at which charge is acquired by the cells may be different among at least some of the cells for at least a determined portion of the period of time.
    * The document provides equations and methods for determining the cell capacity, cell energy content, and the desired cell voltage to provide a specified energy content.
    * The document also describes a method for balancing the cell voltages during the battery charging process to achieve a target drive range.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an AC-to-DC converter that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage, providing a power supply for lamps that reduces eye fatigue and protects eyesight and health.
    • The converter includes various components such as input protection, EMI filter, rectifier, converter, output filter, and control circuits to achieve the desired output.
    • The invention can be used in various applications, including bus AC to DC converter, PFC converter, computer power supply, TV power supply, notebook adapter, battery charger, and more.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides an illumination maintenance system for maintaining a desired illumination profile in a space throughout at least a portion of a day, where the illumination sources include daylight and artificial light.
    • The system comprises a sensor for sensing an illumination level in at least a portion of the space, a plurality of dimmable electric lamps providing artificial light to supplement the daylight illumination, and a control system controlling the dimming levels of the lamps.
    • The control system adjusts the dimming level of each lamp to achieve the desired illumination profile and compensate for the daylight illumination in the space.
    • The dimming level of each lamp is selected from one of a plurality of lighting presets, and the control system fades the electric lamps toward a preset that will result in an appropriate supplementing of the daylight illumination.

• The system can also control at least one electrically controllable window treatment for at least one opening to allow daylight into the space.
    • The control system controls the window treatment to achieve the desired illumination profile in the space throughout at least a portion of the day.
    • The control system stops adjusting the window treatment when the desired illumination profile within a predefined tolerance has been achieved.

• The system can also reduce sun glare through an opening into the space.
    • The control system adjusts the window treatment in the event of sun glare through the opening to reduce the sun glare.
    • The control system stops the adjustment of the window treatment when the sun glare has been minimized.
</summary>

<summary>
* Before September 2001, there were significant vulnerabilities in aviation security, including weaknesses in passenger and baggage screening, access control to secure areas, and protection of air traffic control systems.
    * ATSA created the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) and established security requirements with mandated deadlines.
    * TSA met many of the ATSA deadlines, such as deploying federal passenger screeners and screening all checked baggage, but faced some operational and management challenges.
* TSA is pursuing initiatives to strengthen access control, such as the Transportation Workers Identification Card (TWIC) program and the Computer Assisted Passenger Prescreening System (CAPPS II).
    * TWIC aims to establish a uniform, nationwide standard for secure identification of transportation workers, but operational issues need to be resolved.
    * CAPPS II raises concerns about travelers' privacy rights, which need to be addressed.
* TSA faces longer-term challenges in risk management, funding, coordination, strategic human capital management, and building a results-oriented organization.
