    • The microcomputer may monitor the output of the vehicle control upon starting of the vehicle and/or during running of the vehicle.
    • The rearview mirror system may include light sensors, and the mirror control may establish a value for the drive signal in response to an output of the light sensors.
    • The controller may maintain parameters to help determine the protocol of the reverse-gear indication.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles with an anti-dive device for the front suspension:
    * The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel, either by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel.
    * The anti-dive device suppresses the contracting action of the front fork when the hydraulic braking pressure for the front wheel brake is increased by the anti-lock control unit, quickly increasing the grounding load on the front wheel and minimizing variations in the angular deceleration of the front wheel, thereby improving braking efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to movable partitions and panels used to separate or insulate cargo during transportation or storage, particularly for multi-temperature transport.
    * The partitions and bulkheads can be used to divide the cargo space of trailers, railcars, and containers into sections of varying sizes.
    * The partitions and bulkheads are typically mounted in channels or grooves on the floor or ceiling, held in place by friction, or mechanically fastened.
    * The panels can be moved independently and can be raised and stowed when not in use.
    * The mounting assembly can be a trolley system or any other mechanism that permits rotational, slidable, or hinged movement between the rails and the bulkhead.
* The invention includes an improved partition system with at least two panels that can be independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies.
    * The panels can be slidably attached to separate pairs of ceiling-mounted rails, allowing each panel to be independently moved.
    * The panels can be in the form of half-width bulkheads that are releasably secured to one another and independently, slidably attached to the ceiling.
    * The panels can be raised and stowed by a lift mechanism, reducing the amount of rearward clearance needed.
    * The panels can be secured to one another using various means, such as straps, channels, grooves, flanges, polymeric seals, or locking pins.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and fluid handling systems
    • The valve features a diaphragm-based sealing mechanism that allows the rotor and stator faces to be partially separated for in-place sanitization
    • The valve design includes a barrier fluid flow path that prevents the release of process fluids to the environment and accumulation of dried material on the sealing surfaces
    • The valve can be used in simulated moving bed (SMB) chromatography systems for the separation and purification of biological macromolecules
    • The invention provides a simple and reliable means of ensuring sealing of the valve ports while allowing for intermittent flushing and cleaning of the sealing faces
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an improved gas-liquid contacting tray with directional thrust valves for higher efficiency operation.
    * The tray includes a plurality of apertures with valve covers mounted on first and second legs, where the first leg is wider than the second leg to intercept the liquid flow and divert it around the valve.
    * The valve cover is biased upwardly at the rear to facilitate the initial passage of vapor through the valve, creating a directional thrust.
    * The valves are oriented to direct the liquid flow, which enhances the effectiveness of a raised active inlet area for discharging vapor into the liquid.
    * The invention also includes an improved method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer onto the tray, using the directional thrust valves.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
    * The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor, and a fluid regulator.
    * The vane motor is coupled between the pressurized fluid source and the fluid regulator, and converts the pressurized fluid into mechanical power.
    * The mechanical power generated by the vane motor can be used to power various components, such as a generator, a rotisserie, or other electrical or mechanical devices.
* The invention provides several advantages:
    * It reduces variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure.
    * It is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain.
    * It is lightweight and portable.
* The invention can be used in various applications, such as:
    * Outdoor gas grills
    * Self-contained underwater breathing apparatuses (SCUBA)
    * Vehicles powered by pressurized flammable fluids
    * Any application that requires fluid pressure regulation
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a pallet system that facilitates loading and unloading, and limits the shifting of loaded items.
    * The pallet system includes a pallet with at least one pair of parallel guide rails raised above the top surface of the pallet, which are designed to be straddled by the side supports of trays.
    * The pallet system includes end stops and end plates that help secure the load and restrict the movement of the trays.
* The pallet system allows for automated loading and unloading of trays and provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped.
    * The guide rails restrict both the lateral and longitudinal movement of the trays, and the end plates further restrict the longitudinal movement.
    * The pallet system can be customized for different types of loads, such as egg trays, by adjusting the design of the guide rails and end plates.
</summary>

<summary>
* The electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension comprises:
    * A saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system
    * The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system
    * The rotary-wing system includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail
    * The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, the electromotive ring, and the magnetic suspension shaft constitute a magnetic suspension electric engine
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention concerns streptavidin muteins, a process for the production of such proteins by means of recombinant DNA technology, and the use of these streptavidin muteins for the isolation, purification and determination of biological substances, in particular of other recombinant proteins.
    • The invention describes streptavidin muteins with a higher binding affinity than wild-type streptavidin for peptide ligands.
    • The invention also describes the use of these streptavidin muteins in affinity chromatography, detection methods, and for the immobilization of proteins fused with the peptide ligand.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is concerned with methods of forming substituted guanidines utilizing nickel catalysts.
    • The nickel catalysts utilized in the inventive methods preferably comprise nickel in the zero oxidation state.
        • Suitable Ni(0) catalysts are preferably derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
        • Nickel catalysts are particularly advantageous due to their relatively inexpensive cost and the fact that they are essentially completely recoverable after the guanylation reactions.
        • The nickel catalyst should be present at a level of less than about 10 molar % nickel, and preferably less than about 5 molar % nickel, based upon the total moles of guanylating agent(s).
        • Preferred guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a novel apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum or aluminum alloy strips or wires.
    * The invention aims to provide an apparatus and method for continuously conducting anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires without the need for a large amount of electrical energy.
    * The invention also aims to provide an apparatus and method for continuously conducting anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires to form a colored anodic coating with excellent weatherability or fade resistance.
    * The invention further aims to provide an apparatus and method for continuously conducting anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires without the necessity for connecting the continuously traveling aluminum strip or wire directly to a power source.
* The apparatus comprises:
    * A means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire.
    * An anodic oxidation bath for anodizing the aluminum strip or wire, with a cathode disposed therein.
    * An electrolytic coloring bath for electrolytically coloring the anodized aluminum strip or wire, containing at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid, with an anode disposed therein.
    * An electric circuit for connecting the cathode and the anode to a power source and causing the aluminum strip or wire to function as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath without connecting the aluminum strip or wire directly to a power source.
    * A means for passing the aluminum strip or wire continuously and successively through the baths.
* The thickness of the oxide film formed on the aluminum strip or wire in the anodic oxidation bath is preferably in the range of 4 to 15 microns.
* The electrolytic coloring bath composition and electrolytic conditions can be varied to obtain various color tones on the aluminum strip or wire.
* The apparatus can produce continuously and at low cost aluminum strips or wires having colored oxide films or layers with excellent weatherability or fade resistance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome.
    * The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors that are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination.
    * The DNA sequence of interest is assembled from sequence portions of the at least two different vectors and is integrated into the plant chromosome.
    * The process allows for efficient, rapid, and versatile transformation of plants or plant cells, enabling screening of DNA libraries and directed evolution.
* The invention also provides transgenic plants or parts thereof, as well as libraries of plants or plant seeds, produced or producible by the process.
    * The DNA sequence of interest can be assembled from more than two different vectors, allowing for the creation of a large combinatorial variety of transgenic plants.
    * The process can be used for various applications, including gene function analysis, functional genomics, and the introduction of complex or large DNA sequences into plant chromosomes.
    * The transgenic plants produced by the process can have all coding and expressible sequences of plant origin, avoiding the introduction of unnatural sequences.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing a refrigerant gas, by rotating a swash plate.
    * The invention applies a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate facial surfaces and ends to reduce the frictional wear on the components.
    * The coated swash plate may be made from lower cost alloy materials while maintaining durability and efficiency.
    * Swash plate compressors have a high surface area that contacts the piston shoes, causing a large amount of friction.
    * The interfacial surfaces between the swash plate and pistons are subject to very high load conditions and are susceptible to premature wear.
* The invention provides a coating on a swash plate that is both friction reducing and highly durable.
    * The coating permits the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum base material for the swash plate.
    * The coating does not require the need to electroplate the surface of the swash plate.
    * The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives to enable the polyfluoro elastomer-based coating to simultaneously provide the necessary durability and low coefficient of friction surface.
    * The fluorocarbon coating is applied to the swash plate in an aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides novel chemical compounds suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings in photolithography processes for forming submicro-patterns using 193 nm (ArF) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams in the manufacture of semiconductor devices.
    * The polymers of the present invention are designed to facilitate light absorption at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm by having groups that absorbs light strongly at both wavelengths.
    * The polymers represented by general formulas 1, 2, and 3 can be prepared by reacting polyhydroxystyrene resin, poly(styrene-acrylate) resin, and novolac resin, respectively, with diazonaphthoquinone halide in the presence of an amine.
    * The anti-reflective coating composition of the present invention may also comprise one of the polymers and a light-absorbing compound selected from the group consisting of anthracene and its derivatives, fluorenone derivatives, fluorene and its derivatives, fluorenol, xanthone, quinazarin, and fluorescein.
    * The anti-reflective coating of the present invention can be provided on a semiconductor silicon wafer by coating the filtered solution or composition and "hard-baking" the coating to cross-link the anti-reflective coating polymer.
* The polymers and compositions of the present invention have proven to be excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials during the formation of submicro-patterns in photolithographic processes using 248 nm KrF and 193 nm ArF lasers, as well as E-beam, extreme ultraviolet (EUV) light, and ion beam light sources.
    * The anti-reflective effect provided in accordance with the present invention have also been found to be superior when E-beam, extreme ultraviolet (EUV) light, and ion beam light sources are used instead of an ArF beam.
    * The polymers of the present invention have high solubilities in most of the hydrocarbon solvents, but the anti-reflective coating is rendered insoluble in any solvent after hard-baking.
    * The polymers of the present invention are superior for use in a photoresist film and do not exhibit problems such

<summary>
• The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic
    • The film comprises at least one white pigment, one UV absorber, and one flame retardant, and has good orientability, thermoformability, and mechanical and optical properties
• The film can be produced cost-effectively and is suitable for outdoor applications that demand fire protection or flame retardancy
    • The film passes the fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and the UL 94 test, and has high UV resistance and excellent thermoformability
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis.
    • The process uses 142b and HF as the feed, with a molar ratio of HF:142b greater than 1:1 to avoid the formation of olefinic byproducts.
    • The catalysts used are CrF3.4H2O and Cr/Ni/AlF3, which provide high conversion (over 99%) and selectivity (over 99%) for 143a.
    • The catalyst can be used to hydrofluorinate a feed containing 141b, HCl, and other impurities without affecting the performance.
    • A post-reactor can be used to further hydrogenate any olefinic byproducts to the corresponding saturated compounds.
    • The process can be carried out in an adiabatic reactor, which provides a simple and efficient way to produce 143a.
    • The process can also use 141b as a co-feed with 142b, with high conversion and selectivity.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3##
    • The improved process uses hypophosphorous acid to reduce the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed during the reaction.
    • The use of hypophosphorous acid results in the formation of H2S, which is readily removed, and does not affect other functional groups in the molecule.
• The process involves two steps:
    • Reacting the acylated compound with an acylating agent to form an acylated intermediate.
    • Reacting the acylated intermediate with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the desired pyrazolotriazole.
• The R, R', and R" substituents are inert and do not interfere with the process.
• The process is straight-forward, economical, and readily adaptable by industry.
• The invention is demonstrated through three examples, including the preparation of 6-methyl-3-[1-(4-nitrophenoxy)tridecyl]-1H-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole and 6-t-butyl-3-(3-nitro-2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots.
    * The known method has several disadvantages, such as the presence of fiber residuals and the inability to obtain an optimally homogeneous mixture.
    * The invention aims to eliminate these disadvantages by measuring the entire momentary quantity of each stored fiber lot and removing a predetermined partial quantity from each lot.
    * The partial quantity is determined as a predetermined proportion of the measured quantity and is removed continuously from the measured lot.
    * The partial quantities are removed within a predetermined period to ensure a uniform supply to the after-connected processing machines.
    * The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the operation of the bale opener based on the signals from the measuring device.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel courses of yarns.
    • The key features of the invention include:
        • Use of a rake mechanism synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors and yarn carrying means to achieve parallelism of the yarns.
        • Ability to have successive courses of yarn overlie a portion of an already laid course to control the strength and thickness of the resulting layer.
        • Yarns can be placed between the needles on the conveyors or impaled on them to provide for a more uniform product.
    • The invention allows for the formation of bias laid fabrics where all the yarns in a given layer are parallel to each other without complex machinery.
    • The number of yarns need not equal the number of needles over a given linear dimension, allowing for greater density and uniformity.
    • The invention can be used with various bonding mechanisms, such as stitching, knitting, or adhesive application, to hold the non-woven fabric layers together.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom
    • The apparatus uses different weft carrying forces suited for the different weft threads
• The weft carrying forces are produced by:
    • Ejecting air under different pressures from the main nozzle and subnozzles
    • Ejecting air from the main nozzle and subnozzles for different intervals of time
• The invention aims to insert weft threads at a constant speed and prevent undue consumption of pressurized air
• The invention can be applied to air jet looms using more than two different weft threads
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, and a process of making thereof, in particular, relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, together with a process of making thereof.
    * The process for spinning bast fibres involves the steps of health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, then drawing the carded health preserved bast fibres into bast fibre strips, health preserving the bast fibre strips, and spinning the health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn.
    * The process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres involves the steps of health preserving bast fibres, blending the health preserved bast fibres with other fibres, then opening, cleaning, and carding the blended fibres, drawing the carded blended fibres into multi-fibre strips, health preserving the multi-fibre strips, and spinning the health preserved multi-fibre strips into multi-fibre yarn.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to rolls for use in nipped roll presses, particularly in the manufacture of paper, where the rolls exert pressing forces on webs to form paper, textile material, plastic foil, and other related materials.
    • The invention provides a sensing roll with multiple sensors arranged in different configurations to measure and remove the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of the sensing roll.
        • The sensing roll has multiple sets of sensors placed at different cross-directional positions and circumferentially spaced apart to take multiple pressure measurements at each position.
        • The pressure measurements from the multiple sensors at each position are averaged to obtain a more accurate representation of the nip pressure profile, removing the effects of rotational variability.
        • The invention also provides methods for sensing and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of the sensing roll.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board.
    * The cord support is a flexible mast that can be raised and retracted, and is secured to the ironing board using a C-shaped clamp.
    * The article holder is a detachable component that can be used to hold items such as a spray starch can or a beverage container, and is also secured to the clamp.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine.
    * The device includes a foot pad that attaches to the presser bar and a travelling assembly that moves with the work being sewn.
    * The travelling assembly includes a slidable member that can be positioned by the button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.
    * The slidable member carries a tab that actuates a tripping lever on the machine during the buttonhole sewing process.
    * An adjustable stop on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the buttonhole formation.
    * The adjustable stop allows the operator to precisely define the closure point of the buttonhole to prevent open or overlapping stitches.
    * The device can be adjusted to compensate for different material slippage during sewing to ensure a perfect buttonhole.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid such as a washing or rinsing solution.
    * The apparatus comprises a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
    * The conveyor includes an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined substantially horizontal path.
    * The applicator is disposed at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion thereof along the path.
* The suction device is disposed at a second station along the path at a point downstream of the first station for removing the liquid from the web by a suction process during motion of the web along the path.
    * The suction device preferably extends transversely to the web and to the belt and is disposed below and substantially juxtaposed to an upper section of the belt.
    * The dwell stretch is disposed between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
* The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass, where the textile web is completely free of support or guiding elements at least along major portions of the dwell stretch or loop and is accordingly accessible to the atmosphere at all sides.
    * Alternatively, the dwell stretch can include at least one freely rotatable drum disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt, and the dwell loop extends around the drum.
    * The dwell stretch further includes at least two rollers disposed laterally adjacent to one another below the drum for guiding the web to and from the drum.
* The fabric treatment apparatus can have a compact construction, particularly if the textile web is guided back from the dwell loop to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point where the web leaves the belt.
    * The suction device is advantageously disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt, causing the textile web to adhere to the belt and to be entrained thereby.
    * This entrainment of the textile web by the belt is sufficient to guide the web over several rollers not exhibiting any buoyance, or over drums, without any appreciable longitudinal tensile stresses occurring in the web.
</summary>

<summary>
• The dry cleaning machine has a separate air flow system to bring in ambient air when the door is opened, without exhausting the solvent vapors from the tubs.
    • The air flow system has a separate intake fan and duct, with a normally closed valve to isolate it from the solvent vapors during normal operation.
    • When the door is opened, the intake fan is energized, and the valve is opened to draw in ambient air directly into the duct, minimizing the loss of solvent vapors.
    • The air recirculation system is isolated from the tubs during the spin cycle to prevent uneven drying and the formation of streaks and swales in the clothes.
    • The solvent vapor handling system uses an expandable bag to accommodate the air-vapor mixture and maintain low pressure within the machine.
    • The refrigeration system has a single compressor that can cool either the solvent storage tank or the condenser coils, depending on the stage of the cleaning cycle.
    • The controls include a "cartridge dry" mode that allows the filter cartridges to be dried without advancing the timer or rotating the tub.
    • The door is mechanically locked during the cleaning cycle and can only be unlocked at the end of the cycle by manually pressing a door unlock switch.
    • The machine is controlled primarily by a timer mechanism, with the controls being inaccessible to the customer/user.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing.
    • The invention solves problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems, including spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control.
• The invention uses a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments with a substantially constant filament distribution across the machine width.
    • No air is educted into the system, as the quench fluid undergoes uniform acceleration into the impingement slot where the drawing force is developed.
• The quench air is used for both quenching the filaments and drawing them as the air exits through the drawing impingement slot at high velocity.
    • The drawing chamber is relatively small, allowing for higher quench pressures without structural deflection problems.
• The small amount of close tolerance machined surface area exposed to the fiber stream collects less dirt, polymer drippings, and monomer build-up, making cleaning much simpler.
    • The filament denier can be easily changed by adjusting the size of the nozzle opening, the air flow rate, the quench air temperature, the polymer viscosity, or the polymer throughput.
• The invention can be used to produce a variety of nonwoven materials, including those for sanitary products, limited-use garments, surgical drapes, industrial filtration, automotive carpet, roofing applications, and commercial dryer sheets.
</summary>

<summary>
• The sewing machine includes a bed, a pillar, an arm, and a head
    • The bed is a base portion of the sewing machine and extends in the left-right direction
    • The pillar extends upward from the right end of the bed
    • The arm extends to the left from the upper end of the pillar and faces the bed
    • The head is provided on the left end of the arm
• The sewing machine includes receivers that detect an ultrasonic wave
    • The receivers are provided at the lower left end and the lower right end of the head
    • The receivers are separated from each other in the left-right direction by the length of the head
    • The receivers are configured to receive (detect) an ultrasonic wave
    • The receivers have the same configuration
• The ultrasonic pen includes a pen body, a pen tip, a switch, a signal output circuit, and an ultrasonic transmitter
    • The pen body has a bar shape
    • The pen tip is provided at the leading end of the pen body and has a sharp point
    • The switch is turned on and off in accordance with the position of the pen tip
    • The signal output circuit and the ultrasonic transmitter are activated when the switch is turned on
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to cellulosic fabric or textile materials, particularly methods of applying functional utility enhancing preparations onto cellulosic materials.
    • The preparation comprises a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder, and a binding agent, where the functional additive is carried by the wool particles.
    • The preparation can also comprise a mixture of powdered bamboo fiber, carrier agents, and binding agents, where the bamboo powder is nano-sized.
    • The invention provides methods of preparing the preparations, including pulverizing wool or bamboo into ultrafine powders and forming suspensions.
    • The preparations can be applied to cellulosic fabric materials, such as cotton or linen, to enhance properties like UV protection, antibacterial activity, moisture management, and wrinkle resistance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine that can sew patterns into large fabrics, such as bedspreads and quilts, using a computer-controlled system.
    • The machine consists of a large metal frame on which the fabric is stretched, and a sewing machine head that can move relative to the fabric.
        • The fabric is moved in the X and Y directions using a movable table, controlled by a separate process controller.
        • The sewing machine functions, such as stitching and auxiliary functions, are controlled by a separate process controller.
        • This separation of control allows for independent reprogramming of the sewing machine functions and the table movement, simplifying the process.
        • The machine can also accommodate computer-generated patterns and hand-selected patterns, or a combination of both.
• The invention includes a computer-aided design (CAD) program that allows the operator to draw a pattern on a monitor, which is then automatically converted into machine-readable language and stored in the computer's memory.
    • The CAD program can also be used to duplicate the pattern at multiple locations on the fabric.
    • The separate process controllers for the sewing machine and table movement allow for easier reprogramming of either function without affecting the other.
• The invention aims to increase the production rate of hand-guided patterns sewn into large fabrics, while also providing a system for automatically duplicating individualized patterns.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric exhibiting a three-dimensional image, which can be used in a wide variety of consumer applications.
    * The method involves providing a first precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web comprising a second fibrous matrix, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim interposed between them.
    * The precursor webs are subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device, which imparts a three-dimensional image to the fabric.
    * The incorporation of the support layer or scrim acts as a fiber distribution control layer, limiting the intermingling of the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers.
    * The fabric can have dissimilar fibrous matrices on the two sides, and may also include apertures.
    * The fabric can be used in various applications, such as disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical and industrial protective wear, and apparel.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
    * The device includes a control means that is actuated by the strip of material to control the switching functions of the sewing machine.
* The control means includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip.
    * The movement of the stop controls a signal transmitter for a setting means for the stop.
* The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring and can be moved by a setting means, such as an air cylinder.
    * The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
* The device ensures a continuous operation, allows for sewing relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.
    * The leading edge of the strip contacts the stop, which then triggers the necessary switching processes to start the sewing operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garment parts.
    * The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, where one or both are movable in the longitudinal direction.
* The two tape-shaped knit pieces are positioned with a boundary between them on either the front or rear needle bed.
    * The symmetrical loops of the final course of both the knit pieces are overlaid across the boundary and gradually bound off.
* This process is repeated a proper number of times depending on the width of the two tape-shaped knit pieces until they are connected.
    * The moving side knit fabric and the fixed side knit fabric are joined by stitching one-by-one as if each loop were knitted in spontaneously.
* The flat knitting machine can have two or more pairs of needle beds, with either the front or rear needle bed or both being movable.
    * The matrix texture of the belt-shaped knit fabric can be plain knitting, rib knitting, tubular knitting, or any other.
* The invention can be applied to various garment parts, such as the neck rope part of a tanktop, the lower end portion of baseball stockings, and the neck rope part of an apron.
    * The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together, and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
* The method prevents the end portion of the junction from loosening the stitch and improves the appearance and comfort of the garment.
    * The productivity is also improved by integrating the sewing process into the knitting process, reducing the manufacturing cost.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element with at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength, and a production line and method for embedding the stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic plastics material.
    * The core strand of each stranded cable is sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer to increase flexibility and adhesion.
    * The production line has an extruder with a thread guide and a matrix that can be adjusted relative to each other to precisely position the stranded cables in the plastics material jacket.
    * The method involves degreasing and preheating the stranded cables to improve adhesion with the plastics material jacket.
    * The traction elements have a wide range of use, particularly for lifting and pulling loads, and can also be used as electric conductors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
    * The rotary hook arrangement includes a bobbin housing with a shoulder and a spring rod that cooperates with the shoulder to prevent the bobbin housing from co-rotating with the hook body.
    * The arrangement is designed to minimize impediment to the movement of the needle thread loop during the looping and pull-back processes.
* The rotary hook arrangement includes a capsule release device that gives the bobbin housing a slight rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
    * This creates a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod, allowing the needle thread loop to move through unhindered.
* The rotary hook arrangement provides jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop.
    * Even without the capsule release device, the low-mass spring rod only slightly hinders the needle thread loop movement, resulting in a lower needle thread tension.
* The rotary hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using liquid silane inks by electrospinning.
    * The inks can be four-component or five-component, containing a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent.
    * The five-component inks also contain a solid phase, which can be metal particles, semiconducting particles, or other additives.
    * The electrospun fibers are transformed by thermal or laser processing to produce amorphous or crystalline silicon materials.
    * The silicon-based materials produced can be used as components in composite materials, such as electrodes for lithium-ion batteries.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each with a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension-responsive braking element.
    * The arrangement includes a tensioning lever with a roller that engages the threads and is biased by a fluid pressure-activated biasing arrangement.
* The fluid pressure can be adjusted to control the thread tension for the entire creel or individual spool holders.
    * This allows for global adjustment of thread tension and rapid braking when the machine is shut off.
* An alternate embodiment uses an electromagnetic brake instead of a friction brake.
    * The magnetic system surrounds a conductive braking disc, and the braking force is adjusted by the position of the magnetic system relative to the disc.
* The tensioning lever can also be biased by an additional weight that can be changed or attached to another lever arm.
* The biasing arrangement is preferably a piston-cylinder assembly oriented at an angle to the tensioning lever to optimize the force component.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that overcomes the disadvantages of conventional sewing machine detectors:
    • It provides a low-price, durable detector that is thinner and more compact than conventional detectors.
    • It minimizes stress on the optical fibers by minimizing their curvature.
    • It includes a power indicating light that does not interfere with the operation of the detector and controller.
        • The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs instead of rotary reflective discs.
        • The optical fibers are supported linearly, reducing stress on the fibers.
        • The power indicating light uses an optical fiber, eliminating interference with the control circuitry.
        • The detector is easy to assemble and maintain accurate optical axes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention describes a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
    * The process involves the following critical operations:
        * Completion of the coagulation until a final coagulation index not higher than 1 is obtained.
        * Treatment with water having a non-alkaline pH to reduce the amounts of certain elements retained on the yarn.
    * The resulting yarn has a degree of white not lower than 45, which is higher than commonly accepted, and is achieved through a simplified and economical process.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a deaeration tank for pulp that has been treated with oxygen, to be used before the pulp is washed.
    * The deaeration tank is a small tank with an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl-inducing inlet pipe.
    * The tank is designed to be the same diameter as the oxygen reactor, so it can be placed on top of or hung from the reactor.
    * The tank has no moving parts, allowing it to be placed directly on the reactor without the need for motors.
    * The closed tank design allows for the recovery of steam or oxygen.
    * The tank is designed to optimize deaeration through the placement and sizing of the inlet, outlet, and swirl-inducing inlet.
    * The tank can operate at atmospheric pressure, low pressure, or under vacuum.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention describes a biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite material with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
    • The BTR composite is designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which employs topology optimization to identify the optimal arrangement of fibers, stuffer members, and joints for a given structural function.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a load-limiting device for use in a braced frame structure to dissipate energy during a dynamic event.
    • The load-limiting device can plastically deform in response to high loads, forming a plastic hinge mechanism to limit the loads transmitted to the structure.
    • The load-limiting device can be easily removed and replaced after a dynamic event if it has undergone plastic deformation.
    • The load-limiting device can be integrated into various braced frame configurations, including X-braces and K-braces.
• The load-limiting device is designed to withstand low loads without plastic deformation, but can yield and dissipate energy during high dynamic loads.
    • The device can be made of metal or other materials capable of undergoing plastic deformation.
    • The device can be designed with various geometries to accommodate different bracing configurations.
• The load-limiting device can be checked for plastic deformation after a dynamic event, and can be easily replaced if necessary.
    • The device can have an indicator to visually show if plastic deformation has occurred.
    • The replaced device can be a new, undeformed load-limiting device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The bedroom cabinet described in the text is designed to provide a flophouse facility with individual rooms on the floor of an existing building.
    * The cabinet is composed of an outer casing and an inner casing, providing excellent mechanical strength and allowing for the inclusion of various devices and storage spaces without projecting into the dwelling area.
* The second embodiment of the cabinet features a clearance between the outer and inner casings, with spacer members providing ventilation and sound-proofing.
    * The spacer members are designed with varying strengths to support the different loads and requirements of the different cabinet sections.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the erection of a safety barrier or fence at construction sites.
    • The guard rail support consists of a flat base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.
    • The guard rail support can be anchored to the floor or used with a concrete-filled steel base for added stability.
    • The guard rail support allows for the efficient assembly and disassembly of a safety barrier, preventing damage to the materials and ensuring compliance with safety regulations.
• The safety barrier can be constructed using overlapping wooden rails or with short wooden stubs.
    • The guard rail support can also be used to support a mesh-like fence structure.
    • The guard rail support and associated assembly can be used in various situations, such as around the perimeter of a roof structure or a bridge construction site.
• The guard rail support is designed to be portable, temporary, and easy to install and remove by a single worker.
    • The all-steel construction ensures durability and repeated use, providing a high return on investment.
    • The guard rail support prevents the damage and improper reassembly of guard rails, ensuring the integrity of the safety barrier.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR).
    * The invention uses a coupled process of direct electrohydraulic (EH) acoustic vibrations that propagate outward into the formation from one or more wells, and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations that are generated using both EH and electromagnetic (EM) pulsed power discharge devices.
* The invention includes several embodiments to extend the effective range of the stimulation and to customize the discharge characteristics of the pulse sources to produce specific frequencies that will achieve optimal stimulation.
    * The invention also includes the use of EM pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, and the separation of the recovered fluids from the wellbore into its components.
</summary>

<summary>
* The disclosure provides a splice for a soil reinforcing element that can be used to extend the length of the element.
    * The splice includes a first wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive the transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive the transverse wires of a grid-strip.
    * The splice also includes perforations in the wave plates and a connective device that extends through the perforations to couple the wave plates and clamp down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip.
    * The combination of the soil reinforcing element, splice, and grid-strip forms a composite soil reinforcing element that can be used to reinforce a vertical facing.
* The disclosure also provides a method for splicing a soil reinforcing element to a grid-strip to extend the length of the soil reinforcing element.
    * The method involves seating the transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip in the transverse protrusions of the first and second wave plates, respectively.
    * The method also involves aligning the perforations in the wave plates and inserting a connective device through the perforations to couple the wave plates and clamp down on the longitudinal wires.
    * The method can be repeated with multiple splices and grid-strips to further extend the length of the soil reinforcing element.
* The disclosure emphasizes that the various features and components described can be combined in any combination without departing from the scope of the disclosure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a plow blade with a fluid passageway and points of fluid ejection, which is produced using basic manufacturing processes.
    * The plow blade includes a multiple component assembly, allowing for the replacement of worn parts.
    * The fluid ejection is designed to maximize the desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid, and is adaptable for both static and vibratory plowing.
    * The fluid is ejected at specific points along the plow blade to lubricate the sides of the blade/chute, reducing the amount of drag (friction).
    * The fluid pressure and flow rate can be tailored to specific job requirements by adjusting the length of the fluid tube, the number of leading edge sections, and the location and number of stitch welds.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a building system, particularly stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc.
    • The invention allows for panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and greater than 4 meters width to be created without movement joints.
    • The invention provides a building and/or a building system, related assemblies, subassemblies, procedures, methods, panels, flashings, reinforcements, cavity walls of part stucco construction, etc. that comply with the plaster code NZS4251 and the building code NZS3604.
    • The invention provides stucco walled structures having panel rigidity and integrity.
    • The invention provides methods to meet what is expected to be allowable under NZ regulation.
• The building system comprises:
    • A frame or substructure with studs and battens
    • An inner mesh attached to the battens
    • A second outer mesh supported by a plaster matrix
    • The plaster matrix applied as more than one layer, penetrating the inner mesh and embedding the outer mesh
• The system includes:
    • Reinforcement at openings
    • Lattice-like periphery defining members at panel boundaries
    • Compliance with NZS3604 and NZS4251 requirements
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a safe with a valuables receiving chamber and a door structure that is simple and cost-effective to assemble.
    * The safe has a rectangular opening with a first set of inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement of a plate-shaped steel door.
    * The door is inserted at an angle into a deeper groove on one side, then pivoted and laterally displaced until the other edge is in the shallower groove.
    * The door has a lock assembly with a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar, and reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt to prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a technique for accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations
    • The technique involves cementing a conduit with a filter at the bottom end in a borehole at the desired location
    • The conduit is pressurized with fluid to clear it of cement grout, and a check valve is used to prevent backflow
    • After cementing, fluid is injected into the conduit to displace the cement grout around the filter and establish a fluid connection with the formation
    • In some cases, the method can be followed by a hydrofracture process to further improve the connection
    • The invention provides various embodiments to isolate the pressure sensor from pressures above and below the measurement depth
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and a method of mounting an elastic member therein.
    * The jointing structure comprises steps at the ends of the traveling path, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across an expansion gap.
* The elastic members are designed to be hard to deform vertically but easy to deform horizontally, allowing the joint block to maintain its position during bridge girder expansion and contraction.
    * The joint block is made of the same concrete as the traveling path, providing high slip resistance to tires.
* The components are designed to be detachable, facilitating maintenance.
    * The expansion gap can be decentralized into multiple smaller gaps using intermediate joint blocks, further reducing the risk of tire fall-in or stuck-in situations.
* The expansion gap can be oriented obliquely to the traveling path axis to accommodate small-diameter tires.
    * The method of mounting the elastic members involves deforming them towards the bridge girder axis before fixing them in place, ensuring they are in the optimal position.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a floor track system for transporting wheeled hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber, such as a meat chilling chamber.
    * The system prevents the wheels of the hand trucks from contaminating the recirculated brine solution used for chilling the meat.
    * This is achieved through two different embodiments of the enclosed floor track system:
* One embodiment uses a wheel channel with a cover plate that segregates the wheels from the brine solution.
    * The cover plate can be hinged to allow for easy cleaning of the channel.
    * The vertical space between the cover plate and the inner sidewall accommodates the axle structure of the hand truck.
* Another embodiment uses inflatable elastomer seals around the wheel struts to prevent the brine solution from entering the wheel channel.
    * The inflated seals also act as a brake to prevent the hand trucks from moving along the slightly inclined track.
    * The seals can be deflated to allow for easy removal of the hand trucks from the chamber.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, such as a backhoe, to prevent the boom from being tilted by its own weight.
    * The lock device comprises an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin) that can be manually engaged and disengaged to lock the boom.
    * The engaging member has a slot and a guide member that supports the engaging member and allows it to slide and rotate to the lock and release positions.
    * The guide member is designed to maintain the engaging member in the lock position at any rotation of the boom, simplifying the lock device.
* Additional features of the lock device include:
    * A slanted end surface on the engaging member to prevent damage when engaging the lock pin.
    * A slip-prevention mechanism for the support pin that simplifies assembly.
    * Integrated guide members on the boom bracket to reduce parts and assembly.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform and a central, vacuum portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom to regulate suction efficiency.
    • The device has a suction head connected to a flexible suction line and an elongated handle.
    • The device overcomes the drawbacks of prior art devices by providing an adjustment mechanism on the vacuum head to regulate the suction being exerted.
    • The adjustment mechanism is located on the top of the suction head and can be operated by hand without tools.
    • The suction can be precisely regulated without adjusting the remote suction source.
    • The adjustment mechanism can be provided as a kit to be added to certain existing pool cleaning devices.
    • The adjustment mechanism is simple, easy to use, and inexpensive to manufacture.
    • The device has outboard roller assemblies with adjustable rollers to adjust the spacing between the platform and the pool bottom.
    • The device has inboard roller assemblies with adjustable rollers to adjust the spacing between the central, suction portion of the platform and the pool bottom.
    • The adjustment mechanism uses a frame member, connector, and wing nut to vertically adjust the inboard rollers and the central, suction portion of the platform.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving the wear bushing from around the interior of the well head and casing, including a sub-unit for mounting it onto the drill string.
    * The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel section and a retriever section that can slide along the mandrel section.
* The retriever section has protruding members that engage with slots in the wear bushing, allowing it to be rotated and retrieved.
    * The sliding mechanism of the retriever section along the mandrel prevents damage to the wear bushing or the retriever section due to the weight of the drill string.
* The invention also includes an alternative embodiment with a threaded lower end on the retriever section to engage with a threaded wear bushing.
    * The placement of the retriever section on the sub-unit is the same as in the preferred embodiment.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive way to retrieve the wear bushing without damaging it or the retriever section.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a downhole vibratory tool that allows passage of other tools through a central passage, which can be subsequently closed by a drop-in plug.
    • The tool features an annular dump valve that opens and closes without slamming against a seat, allowing for a clear central passage.
    • The tool utilizes a modular piston stack design to increase the power delivery of the vibrations, which can be operated with or without impacts.
    • The tool's components are designed to be more robust and reliable compared to previous designs that used a drop-in dart.
    • The tool can be used in various applications, such as stimulation or fishing operations, to provide large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall using pre-manufactured components, which allows for taller walls and shorter bases.
    • The retaining wall comprises two discrete, modular parts:
        • A precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort piece
        • A precast concrete base piece
    • The face panel and base are connected by inserting the exposed ends of rebar from the counterfort into openings in the base and securing them with grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring.
    • The invention also allows for flexibility in the height or width of the individual components, which can be easily customized to different sizes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for improving oil or gas production in wells with viscosity or paraffin blockage issues.
    • The system is designed to focus heat on the production zone to heat the oil and paraffin in situ, allowing them to flow to the well bore for pumping.
    • The system also features an improved design for the heating unit to protect the electrical components from damage and shorting due to down hole fluids.
    • The invention also includes a method for using the down hole heating system, which can be used with cable instead of pipe to support the heating unit during well treatments or maintenance.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore.
    * The mechanism can effectively take the form of an external pull tool or overshot, or an internal pull tool or spear, depending on the particular service operation involved.
    * The tool structure includes an outer tubular body and an inner body structure disposed in movable relation within the outer body.
* The mechanism includes a catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position, depending on the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures.
    * A pin structure forming part of the catch mechanism is selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves, and a control spring ensures the pin alternately enters one of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.
    * Unlocking can be achieved by downward movement of the control line tool followed by upward movement, and locking can be achieved by downward movement followed by upward movement.
* The mechanism can be used for a variety of down hole service operations, including installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.
    * The mechanism can be latched and unlatched as many times as necessary to accomplish the service operation.
    * If the pulling tool is undersized for the particular pulling operation, it can be unlatched, removed from the well bore, and replaced with a heavier-duty overshot mechanism.
</summary>

<summary>
• The example embodiment relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
    • The method involves providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm.
    • The substrates are assembled using multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means.
• The example embodiment addresses the drawbacks of conventional composed stave floors, such as deformation, detachment, and limited durability.
    • The example composed stave floor provides increased durability and allows for corrective maintenance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladder attachments that position the ladder away from the work surface, prevent the ladder from defacing the work surface, and prevent the ladder from slipping or sliding.
    * The ladder attachment includes an extension arm with a flange on one end and a resilient pad assembly on the other end.
    * The flange has openings to attach a U-bolt that secures the attachment to the ladder rung.
* The ladder attachment provides a non-slip gripping portion that increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, improving lateral stability.
    * The resilient pad assembly can pivot horizontally, allowing the ladder to straddle corners.
* The ladder attachment can be constructed with heavier materials or additional bolts to resist inward or outward movement of the arms.
    * This can be useful for less substantial ladders where the U-bolt cannot be tightened enough.
* The invention aims to solve the problems of ladder instability, work surface damage, and difficulty in reaching corners.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to a collated fastener assembly that includes a row of fasteners arranged substantially parallel to each other and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
    • The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, or an epoxy, and is preheated prior to molding to enhance adhesion to the fasteners.
    • The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions, which can be configured to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
    • The nozzle comprises a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a particular design.
    • The nozzle can be connected to a sealant cartridge or injection machine and facilitates the injection of sealants with precision.
• The nozzle has an outlet shaped as a bell or hood to facilitate the encapsulation of rivets or screws, particularly in the aeronautical industry.
    • The injection button has a special design with channels and orifices to guide the injection of the sealant around the rivets and nuts.
• The nozzle can be used for both manual and automated sealant injection processes.
    • The nozzle can be used in various industries, including the aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics industries.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to position and motion sensors, particularly for use in mechanical systems with moving parts.
    * The sensors generate an electrical signal proportional to the distance between a moving object and a fixed position.
    * The sensors need to be able to handle various types of noise, including low-frequency and high-frequency noise.
    * The sensors are designed to be multiplexed on a minimum number of wires, reducing the cost and complexity of the system.
    * The sensors include a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and remove unneeded power.
* The error correction generator includes a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor to provide the error correction signal.
    * The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed.
    * The error correction generator includes a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit to constantly compare the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generate a correction signal.
    * The error correction generator includes a window reference circuit that constantly compares the desired conditioned sensor signal output to the existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the output if it is above or below a preset reference signal.
    * The signal processor includes a DAC and counter combination circuit with enough resolution to ensure that the error correction signal is not a significant portion of the sensor position signal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention discloses a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that provides variable valve displacement control.
    * The system uses a rotating cam and a translating mechanism to generate a reciprocating linear motion.
    * This linear motion is then converted into a variable reciprocating motion that controls the valve position.
    * The variable valve displacement is achieved by rotating a link that changes the angle of the slot in which the valve pins ride.
    * The rotation of the link is controlled by an adjustable slide that can be actuated by an electromechanical or hydraulic system.
    * The variable valve control allows for efficient engine operation by controlling the amount of air/fuel mixture entering each cylinder.
    * The system can be configured to selectively deactivate cylinders when the engine is operating at low loads, further improving fuel efficiency.
    * The desmodromic design eliminates the need for valve springs, reducing power losses and allowing for higher engine speeds.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs
    • The light member includes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side
        • The lighting control region includes a first control channel, a second control channel, and a neutral channel
    • The light member includes one or more light-emitting modules that are releasably coupled to the lighting control region
        • The modules can be positioned along the lighting control region and can emit different colors of light
• The light member can be used in various applications, including underneath cabinets
    • The light member can be coupled to a bracket that is mounted to the cabinet
        • The light member can be part of a series of light members connected in series under the cabinet
• The light member can include switches to control the different channels
    • The switches can be disposed on the side or bottom of the light member
        • The light member can also include an optics member, such as a lens or diffuser, that can be coupled to the bottom side of the light member
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine that operates at high temperatures.
    * The apparatus is a known stator blade or rotor blade for a gas turbine.
    * The invention aims to provide a cooled flow deflection apparatus that is simple to produce, can be flexibly matched to the application, and is efficiently cooled.
* The invention uses separate inserts as substitutes for cast separating walls to bound the cooling channels.
    * The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and are inserted through the blade root or blade tip.
    * The inserts offer several advantages, such as reduced thermal stresses, simplified casting, and easier adjustment of the cooling system.
* The flow deflection apparatus can be a hollow casting with holders in the form of rails to secure the inserted separating walls.
    * The separating walls can be connected to the apparatus by an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding.
    * The apparatus can be a blade in a gas turbine, with the cooling channels and separating walls extending radially and the joint at the end close to the axis.
* The invention can also be applied to existing blades by removing the cast separating walls and inserting separate ones.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control.
    • The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or a stepper motor to automatically set the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
    • The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall, and provides full operation of the vehicle during manual control.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a waste fuel burner that addresses the inefficiencies and pollution issues of conventional hog fuel burners:
    • It forms a conical pile of waste fuel, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile to dry and gasify the fuel.
    • The volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber, and then fully combusted in a secondary combustion chamber, with the air flow and temperature controlled to minimize particulate emissions and slag formation.
• The burner design allows for quick response to changes in load, efficient combustion of wet fuels, and reduced maintenance requirements compared to conventional hog fuel burners.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes an evaporative refrigeration system that separates the evaporating water from the cooling air stream using a heat exchanger, achieving sensible cooling without adding moisture to the useful air.
    * The system uses return air from the enclosure as the working air on the wet side of the heat exchanger, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than fresh air, resulting in greater cooling efficiency.
    * The system can be further enhanced by:
        * Recirculating a portion of the return air to mix with the fresh air, increasing the cooling rate but at a higher energy cost.
        * Diverting a portion of the cooled air to mix with the working return air, providing lower useful air temperatures but at a higher energy cost.
* The heat exchanger design uses an array of vertically oriented, hollow tubular members with water flowing down the inner surfaces and working air flowing countercurrently through the tubes.
    * The dry side of the heat exchanger uses fresh air flowing across the outer surfaces of the tubes, with the cooled air distributed to the enclosure.
    * The moisture-laden exhaust air from the wet side can be used to pre-cool the incoming fresh air, further improving efficiency.
* A hybrid system is described that incorporates a vapor compression refrigeration unit, where a minor portion of the cooled air is further dehumidified by passing through the evaporator coil.
    * The condensing coil of the refrigeration unit is placed in the exhaust air stream from the wet side of the heat exchanger, reducing the energy required for the vapor compression system.
* The evaporative refrigeration system is more efficient and less energy-intensive compared to a standard vapor compression refrigeration unit of similar cooling capacity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series to pump fluid from a reservoir
    * Each pump head comprises a housing with an impeller driven by a drive structure
    * The housing has an inlet through which fluid is drawn and at least two fluid conduits through which fluid is moved
* The pump heads are connected in series such that fluid flows from one pump head to the next
    * One or more pump heads may have a combiner that combines the fluid flow from the conduits into a single flow
* The drive structure, which may comprise one or more drive shafts, commonly drives the impellers in the pump heads
    * The drive structure may pass through the fluid flow path between pump heads
* The pump can be mounted on various support structures, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer
    * The support structures allow the pump to be positioned and submerged in a fluid reservoir
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an engine compression release brake system that uses less than all engine cylinders
    • The engine includes an engine housing with a plurality of engine cylinders
    • An engine compression release brake is provided for a portion, less than all, of the engine cylinders
    • The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve
• The invention provides a method of engine braking using less than all engine cylinders
    • The method includes attaching an engine compression release brake to an engine housing for a portion, less than all, of the engine cylinders
    • The portion of engine cylinders is then operated in a braking mode
    • The engine compression release brake is activated during the compression stroke of the piston to vent compressed air through the exhaust valve
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
    • The link assembly includes:
        • A male link coupled to the engine or the gearbox
        • A female link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, which receives the male link to allow translation and form a radial interface that dampens the translation
        • A pin releasably coupled to the male link and the female link to selectively retain them
    • The gearbox assembly includes:
        • A gearbox
        • The link assembly to couple the engine to the gearbox
    • The technical function of the invention is to allow translation and dampen it through the radial interface, and to selectively retain the male and female links with the pin.
    • The invention aims to prevent damage to the gearbox and its attached peripherals during extreme loads, such as those caused by blade-off events, while preventing the gearbox from detaching from the engine.
    • The pin can shear at a known load magnitude to allow the male and female links to translate and the radial interface to provide coulomb damping.
    • The snap ring can limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link.
    • The invention obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to be capable of surviving extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to archery equipment, particularly apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts.
    * The invention provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight to achieve perfect balance, as well as a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft.
    * The invention also provides means to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft, and a design that allows the replacement of a damaged point cap without rendering the more expensive arrow shaft useless.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training
    • It provides a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash
    • It is an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon
    • It is a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device
    • It provides a pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressuration of the ignition chamber
• The simulator consists of various electrical components and circuits
    • It includes a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, 500 Hertz oscillator, 10 Hertz oscillator, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, and firing sensors
    • It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system
    • The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit which can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech
    • The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semi-automatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt
</summary>

<summary>
